H0.text: Diffusion is the method by which paracrine signals move through the extracellular matrix.

H1.text: Osmosis is the method by which paracrine signals move through the extracellular matrix.

H2.text: Deposition is the method by which paracrine signals move through the extracellular matrix.

H3.text: Transfusion is the method by which paracrine signals move through the extracellular matrix.

A4.text: Cells that produce paracrine factors secrete them into the immediate extracellular environment. Factors then travel to nearby cells in which the gradient of factor received determines the outcome.

A5.text: The exact distance that paracrine factors can travel is not certain.

A6.text: High-molecular-weight hyaluronan forms a diffusional barrier that regulates local extracellular diffusion.
